Dear Prof. Goodwin:
This is great news. I would like to help you, by offering the use of one or
more (graduate) students here to help develop process models for waste to
energy gasification reactors. The initial work would be all equilibrium.
Please let me know how best to proceed. Do you have any sponsored research
that could help support student stipends? If not, may be I could get one of
my two sponsors to help. Please let me know how this could be done, directly
or indirectly. Is Cantera an official Caltech project, or just a development
project with you as the sole proprietor?

Regards, Dr. Colin Hackett 	Principal Investigator - Waste to Energy
Projects
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-----
Colin Hackett, Ph.D., P.E. 		| E-mail: colin@...

Research and Technology			| Riverside, CA 92521-0434




-----Original Message-----
From: dggoodwin [mailto:dgoodwin@...]
Sent: Friday, February 15, 2002 9:00 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] progress report



Sometimes I wonder what I've gotten myself into with Cantera... it
turns out (big surprise) that developing a large software project is
A Big Job. Particularly when one has a day job...

Anyway, significant progress is being made, although it may not seem
like it (to anyone but me). In particular, the first really-useful
Cantera application is almost ready - a one dimensional reacting-flow
application, that can be used to simulate:

- 1D laminar flames
- counterflow flames
- stagnation-point flows with surface chemistry (CVD, catalysis, etc.)

I expect it will be ready to ship in a couple of weeks... stay tuned.
